title: 108_hr4371
content: The "State and Local Government Economic Empowerment Act" allows state and local governments to be eligible for interest-free loans. State, county, incorporated municipality, and Indian tribe eligible for interest-free loans under the "State and Local Government Economic Empowerment Act" based on population size and specific loan limits. Incorporated municipalities are eligible for a $600 loan, while Indian tribes are eligible for a $1,000 loan under the "State and Local Government Economic Empowerment Act." The Secretary will issue interest-free loans to government units for capital projects like streets, highways, and infrastructure improvements. Administrative provisions are also included. Loans under section 3 can be disbursed in a lump sum or partially for construction projects. Disbursements must start within 5 years of the Act's enactment. The loan maturity period is based on the infrastructure's useful life, ranging from 10 to 30 years. State law may apply. The maximum loan maturity period is 30 years. State law may apply to the number, amounts, or maturity period of interest-free loans to governmental units. An administrative fee, not exceeding 0.25% of the loan amount, will be imposed. Repayment terms require quarterly payments by the recipient. Quarterly payments are required for loans, calculated by dividing the total amount by the number of calendar quarters within the loan's maturity period. The Secretary enforces collection of past due amounts when 4 or more quarterly payments are outstanding, and may seek court orders to impound delinquent amounts. The Secretary can impound debtor's funds to reduce delinquency, debtor waives right to defend against collection, collection costs added to loan principal, debtor must pay balance according to loan terms. In accordance with the terms of the loan, a debtor must continue to meet the repayment schedule for the remaining principal and fees. Loans made under section 3 must be repaid to the Secretary as per the terms established in the Act and deposited into the Treasury of the United States. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Commerce. The term "Indian tribe" includes any recognized group eligible for special programs for Indians. The term "State" encompasses various regions including the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico. SEC. 6. PROGRAM AUTHORITY. SEC. 6. PROGRAM AUTHORITY. Loans will be made available to entities described in section 2(a) as necessary, using funds from the Treasury.
